Name: Stefano Sollima
Bio: Stefano Sollima was born in Rome, Lazio, Italy.

Name: David Fincher
Bio: David Fincher was born in Denver, Colorado, and was raised in Marin County, California. When he was 18 years old he went to work for John Korty at Korty Films in Mill Valley. He subsequently worked at ILM (Industrial Light and Magic) from 1981-1983. Fincher left ILM to direct TV commercials and music videos after signing with N. Lee Lacy in Hollywood.

Name: Guy Ritchie
Bio: Guy Ritchie was born in Hatfield, Hertfordshire. After watching Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969) as a child, Guy realized that what he wanted to do was make films. He never attended film school, saying that the work of film school graduates was boring and unwatchable. At 15 years old, he dropped out of school and in 1995, got a job as a runner, ultimately starting his film career.

Name: Quentin Tarantino
Bio: Quentin Jerome Tarantino was born in Knoxville, Tennessee. His father, Tony Tarantino, is an Italian-American actor and musician from New York, and his mother, Connie (McHugh), is a nurse from Tennessee. Quentin moved with his mother to Torrance, California, when he was four years old.

Name: John McTiernan
Bio: John McTiernan was born in Albany, New York, USA as John Campbell McTiernan Jr. He is a director and producer

Name: James Cameron
Bio: James Francis Cameron was born in Kapuskasing, Ontario, Canada. He moved to the United States in 1971. The son of an engineer, he majored in physics at California State University before switching to English, and eventually dropping out. He then drove a truck to support his screenwriting ambition.

Name: Drew Goddard
Bio: Drew Goddard was raised in Los Alamos, New Mexico. He attended Los Alamos High School in Los Alamos, New Mexico and graduated in 1993. He then attended the University of Colorado, and worked as a production assistant in L.A. after graduation.

Name: Yorgos Lanthimos
Bio: Yorgos Lanthimos was born in Athens, Greece. He studied directing for Film and Television at the Stavrakos Film School in Athens. He has directed a number of dance videos in collaboration with Greek choreographers, in addition to TV commercials, music videos, short films and theater plays.

Name: Alan Dennis Metter
Bio: Metter grew up in the Boston area, lived in the Hollywood Hills for most of his adult life, and moved to South Florida in 2009.  Alan began his creative life at Doyle Dane Bernbach, the legendary advertising agency. In the late 1970s, Metter leaped at the opportunity to direct some of the first music videos for the likes of George Harrison, Glenn Frey, Joe Walsh, Chicago, Olivia Newton-John, and Donna Summer, as well as comedians Rodney Dangerfield and Steve Martin, which were aired on the fledgling MTV.

Name: Jonathan Demme
Bio: Jonathan Demme was born in Baldwin, Long Island, New York, USA as Robert Jonathan Demme. He was a director and producer.

Name: John Hughes
Bio: John Hughes was born in Lansing, Michigan, USA as John Wilden Hughes Jr.

Name: Harold Ramis
Bio: Born on in Chicago, Illinois, Harold Allen Ramis got his start in comedy as Playboy magazine's joke editor and reviewer. In 1969, he joined Chicago's Second City's Improvisational Theatre Troupe before moving to New York to help write and perform in "The National Lampoon Show" with other Second City graduates including John Belushi, Gilda Radner and Bill Murray.

Name: C. Robert Cargill
Bio: Christopher Robert Cargill was born on September 8, 1975 in San Antonio, Texas, USA as Christopher Robert Cargill. He is a writer, known for Doctor Strange (2016), Sinister (2012) and Sinister 2 (2015). He has been married to Jessica Cargill since May 4, 2002.

Name: Farrelly Brothers
Bio: Peter John Farrelly was born in Phoenixville, Pennsylvania, Bobby Farrelly was born in Cumberland, Rhode Island.

Name: Scott Derrickson
Bio: Scott Derrickson was born in Denver Colorado.  He is a producer and writer.

Name: Terry Gilliam
Bio: Terry Gilliam was born near Medicine Lake, Minnesota. When he was 12 his family moved to Los Angeles where he became a fan of MAD magazine. In his early twenties he was often stopped by the police who suspected him of being a drug addict and Gilliam had to explain that he worked in advertising. In the political turmoil in the 60's, Gilliam feared he would become a terrorist and decided to leave the USA. He moved to England and landed a job on the children's television show Do Not Adjust Your Set as an animator. There he met meet his future collaborators in Monty Python: Terry Jones, Eric Idle and Michael Palin. In 2006 he renounced his American citizenship.

Name: Mike Judge
Bio: Mike Judge was born on October 17, 1962 in Guayaquil, Ecuador as Michael Craig Judge. He is a writer and producer.

Name: Mary Harron
Bio: Mary Harron was born in Bracebridge, Ontario, Canada.

Name: Frank Darabont
Bio: Frank Darabont was born in a refugee camp in 1959 in Montbeliard, France, the son of Hungarian parents who had fled Budapest during the failed 1956 Hungarian revolution. Brought to America as an infant, he settled with his family in Los Angeles and attended Hollywood High School.

Name: Francis Ford Coppola
Bio: Francis Ford Coppola was born in Detroit, Michigan, but grew up in a New York suburb in a creative, supportive Italian-American family. His father, Carmine Coppola, was a composer and musician. His mother, Italia Coppola (n√©e Pennino), had been an actress.

Name: Lilly Wachowski
Bio: Lilly Wachowski was born in Chicago, Illinois.

Name: Lana Wachowski
Bio: Lana Wachowski was born in Chicago, Illinois.

Name: Stanley Kubrick
Bio: Stanley Kubrick was born in Manhattan, New York City, to Sadie Gertrude (Perveler) and Jacob Leonard Kubrick, a physician. His family were Jewish immigrants (from Austria, Romania, and Russia).  He died in Harpenden, Hetfordshire, England.

Name: John G. Avildsen
Bio: John G. Avildsen was born in Oak Park, Illinois, USA as John Guilbert Avildsen. He was a director and editor. He was married to Tracy Brooks Swope and Marie Olga Maturevich. He died in Los Angeles, California, USA.

Name: Kathryn Bigelow
Bio: Kathryn Bigelow was born in San Carlos, California USA.  She was married to James Cameron from 1989 to 1991.

Name: Rowdy Herrington
Bio: Rowdy Herrington was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA.

Name: Amy Heckerling
Bio: Amy Heckerling was born in the Bronx, New York City, New York, USA.  She studied Film and TV at New York University and got a Masters Degree in Film from The American Film Institute.

Name: Alan Parker
Bio: Alan Parker was born in Islington, London, England.  He is the son of Elsie Ellen, a dressmaker, and William Leslie Parker, a house painter, Alan Parker was a London advertising copywriter before moving onto feature films.  He died in London

Name: Jeff Kanew
Bio: Jeff Kanew was born in New York City, New York, USA as Jeffrey Roger Kanew. He is an editor and director.

Name: Richard Donner
Bio: Richard Donner was born in New York City, New York, USA as Richard D. Schwartzberg. He is a director and producer. He has been married to Lauren Shuler Donner since November 27, 1986.

Name: Bob Clark
Bio: Bob Clark was born in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA.  He was a director and writer.  He died in a car accident in Pacific Palisades, California.

Name: Robert Redford
Bio: Charles Robert Redford, Jr. was born in Santa Monica, California, to Martha (Hart), from Texas, and Charles Robert Redford, an accountant for Standard Oil, who was originally from Connecticut. He is of English, Scottish, Cornish, and Irish ancestry.

Name: David Zucker
Bio: David Zucker was born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, USA.  He was married to Danielle Zucker from 1997 to 2019 and has two children

Name: George Roy Hill
Bio: George Roy Hill was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota USA.  His work was frequently derided as 'impersonal' or lacking in stylistic trademarks because of shunning limelight and avoiding appearances.  He died in New York City.

Name: Michael Mann
Bio: Michael Kenneth Mann was born in Chicago, Illinois, USA.  He was a student of London's International Film School.  He began his career in the late 70s.

Name: Christopher Nolan
Bio: Christopher Nolan was born in London, England.  He is a writer and director who has worked on some of the biggest blockbusters ever made.

Name: Neill Blomkamp
Bio: Neill Blomkamp was born in Johannesburg, South Africa. He is a director and writer. He is married to Terri Tatchell. They have one child.

Name: Lee Daniels
Bio: Lee Daniels was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA.  He is an Academy Award nominated filmmaker.

Name: Alfonso Cuar√≥n
Bio: Alfonso Cuar√≥n Orozco was born in Mexico City, Mexico. From an early age, he yearned to be either a film director or an astronaut. However, he did not want to enter the army, so he settled for directing.

Name: Paul Haggis
Bio: Paul Haggis was born in London, Ontario, Canada.  He established himself over twenty years with an extensive career in television, before his big break into features.

Name: C√©dric Klapisch
Bio: C√©dric Klapisch was born in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine, France. He is a director and writer. He has been married to Lola Doillon since 2002. They have one child.

Name: Terry Zwigoff
Bio: Terry Zwigoff was born in Appleton, Wisconsin, USA.  Zwigoff held several jobs before making his breakthrough in film.

Name: Darren Aronofsky
Bio: Darren Aronofsky was born in Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA.  Growing up, Darren was always artistic: he loved classic movies and, as a teenager, he even spent time doing graffiti art. After high school, Darren went to Harvard University to study film.

Name: K√°tia Lund
Bio: K√°tia Lund was born in S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil. She is a director and writer.

Name: Fernando Meirelles
Bio: Fernando Meirelles was born in a middle class family in S√£o Paulo City, Brazil. He studied architecture at the university of S√£o Paulo. At the same time he developed an interest in filmmaking. With a group of friends he started producing experimental videos and video art.

Name: Ben Stiller
Bio: Benjamin Edward Meara Stiller was born in New York City, New York, to legendary comedians Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara. His father was of Austrian Jewish and Polish Jewish descent, and his mother was of Irish Catholic descent (she converted to Judaism).  He is an actor, director, writer, and producer.

Name: Antoine Fuqua
Bio: Antoine Fuqua was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA.  He is an American film director.

Name: Ridley Scott
Bio: Ridley Scott was born in South Shields, County Durham, England.  His father was an officer in the Royal Engineers and the family followed him as his career posted him throughout the United Kingdom and Europe before they eventually returned to Teesside.

Name: Steven Soderbergh
Bio: Steven Andrew Soderbergh was born in Atlanta, Georgia, USA, the second of six children of Mary Ann (Bernard) and Peter Soderbergh. His father was of Swedish and Irish descent, and his mother was of Italian ancestry.

Name: Alejandro G. I√±√°rritu
Bio: Alejandro Gonz√°lez I√±√°rritu (ih-nyar-ee-too) was born in Mexico City, Mexico. Gonz√°lez I√±√°rritu is the first Mexican director to be nominated for the Academy Award for Best Director and by the Directors Guild of America for Best Director.

Name: Paul Thomas Anderson
Bio: Paul Thomas Anderson was born in Studio City, California, USA.  He is married to Maya Rudolph and they have four children.

Name: Spike Jonze
Bio: Spike Jonze was born Adam Spiegel in Rockville, Maryland, USA.  He was married to Sofia Coppola from 1999 to 2003.

Name: Sam Mendes
Bio: Samuel Alexander Mendes was born in Reading, England, UK to parents James Peter Mendes, a retired university lecturer, and Valerie Helene Mendes, an author who writes children's books.

Name: Wes Anderson
Bio: Wesley Wales Anderson was born in Houston, Texas. His mother, Texas Ann (Burroughs), is an archaeologist turned real estate agent, and his father, Melver Leonard Anderson, worked in advertising and PR.

Name: Peter Cattaneo
Bio: Peter Cattaneo was born on July 1, 1964 in Twickenham, London, England. He is a director and writer.

Name: Tony Kaye
Bio: Tony Kaye was born in London, United Kingdom. He has made several well-known music videos.  Kaye is a six time Grammy nominated music video director.

Name: Curtis Hanson
Bio: Curtis Hanson was born in Reno Nevada, USA.  In 1999 he was the first chairman of the UCLA Film and Television Archive.  He died in Los Angeles, California.

Name: Jay Roach
Bio: Jay Roach was born in Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA as Mathew Jay Roach. He is a producer and director. He has been married to Susanna Hoffs since April 17, 1993. They have two children.

Name: Gus Van Sant
Bio: Gus Van Sant was born in Louisville, Kentucky, USA as Gus Greene Van Sant Junior. He is a director and producer.

Name: Barry Levinson
Bio: Barry Levinson was born in Baltimore, Maryland, to Violet (Krichinsky) and Irvin Levinson, who worked in furniture and appliance. He is of Russian Jewish descent. Levinson graduated from high school in 1960, attended college at American University in Washington, DC.

Name: James L. Brooks
Bio: James L. Brooks was born in Brooklyn, New York, USA as James Lawrence Brooks. He is a writer and producer. He was previously married to Holly Holmberg Brooks and Marianne Catherine Morrissey.

Name: Mel Gibson
Bio: Mel Columcille Gerard Gibson was born in Peekskill, New York, USA, as the sixth of eleven children of Hutton Gibson, a railroad brakeman, and Anne Patricia (Reilly) Gibson (who died in December of 1990). His mother was Irish, from County Longford, while his American-born father is of mostly Irish descent.  Mel and his family moved to Australia in the late 1960s, settling in New South Wales. After high school, Mel studied at the University of New South Wales in Sydney, performing at the National Institute of Dramatic Arts.

Name: John Lasseter
Bio: John Lasseter was born in Hollywood, California.  He and his twin sister Johanna were raised in Wittier near Los Angeles. His parents were Jewell Mae (Risley), an art teacher, and Paul Eual Lasseter, a parts manager at a Chevrolet dealership.

Name: Bryan Singer
Bio: Bryan Singer was born in New York City, New York, USA as Bryan Jay Singer. He is a producer and director.

Name: Tom Shadyac
Bio: Tom Shadyac was born in Falls Church, Virginia.  He moved to Los Angeles in 1983 and, at age 24, and became the youngest staff joke writer ever for comedian Bob Hope. Shadyac received his master's degree in film from UCLA in 1989.

Name: Kevin Smith
Bio: Kevin Patrick Smith was born in Red Bank but grew up in Highlands, New Jersey, the son of Grace (Schultz) and Donald E. Smith, a postal worker. He is very proud of his native state; this fact can be seen in all of his movies. Kevin is of mostly German, with some Irish and English, ancestry.

Name: Chuck Russell
Bio: Chuck Russell was born in Park Ridge, Illinois, USA. He is a director and producer. He has been married to Ania Zeyne since November 29, 2007.

Name: Joseph Ruben
Bio: Joseph Ruben was born in Briarcliff, New York, USA. He is a director and writer.

Name: David Mickey Evans
Bio: David Mickey Evans was born in Wilkes Barre, Pennsylvania, USA. He is a director and writer.

Name: Andrew Davis
Bio: Andrew Davis was born in Chicago, Illinois.  He is a director, producer, and writer with a reputation for directing intelligent thrillers.

Name: Joel Schumacher
Bio: Joel Schumacher was born in New York City, New York, USA as Joel T. Schumacher. He was a director and writer. He died in New York City.

Name: Stuart Linklater
Bio: Self-taught writer-director Richard Stuart Linklater was born in Houston, Texas, to Diane Margaret (Krieger), who taught at a university, and Charles W. Linklater III. Richard was among the first and most successful talents to emerge during the American independent film renaissance of the 1990s.

Name: Stephen Herek
Bio: Stephen Herek was born in San Antonio, Texas, USA as Stephen Robert Herek. He is a producer and director.

Name: Martin Brest
Bio: Martin Brest was born in The Bronx, New York City, New York, USA. He is a director and actor,

Name: Barry Sonnenfeld
Bio: Barry Sonnenfeld was born and raised in New York City. He graduated from New York University Film School in 1978.  He is married to Susan Ringo, and they have one child.

Name: Jim Abrahams
Bio: Jim Abrahams was born in Shorewood, Wisconsin, USA. He is a writer and producer. He is married to Nancy Cocuzzo.

Name: Woody Allen
Bio: Woody Allen was born Allan Stewart Konigsberg in Brooklyn, New York, to Nettie (Cherrie), a bookkeeper, and Martin Konigsberg, a waiter and jewellery engraver. His father was of Lithuanian Jewish descent, and his maternal grandparents were Austrian Jewish immigrants. As a young boy, he became intrigued with magic tricks and playing the clarinet, two hobbies that he continues today.

Name: Martin Scorsese
Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese was born in Queens, New York City, to Catherine Scorsese (n√©e Cappa) and Charles Scorsese, who both worked in Manhattan's garment district, and whose families both came from Palermo, Sicily. He was raised in the neighborhood of Little Italy, which later provided the inspiration for several of his films.

Name: Warren Beatty
Bio: Warren Beatty was born in Richmond, Virginia.  He has been said to have demonstrated a greater longevity in movies than any actor of his generation. Few people have taken so many responsibilities for all phases of the production of films as producer, director, writer, and actor, and few have evidenced so high a level of integrity in a body of work. He and his wife, Annette Bening, live in Los Angeles and have four children.

Name: Steven Spielberg
Bio: Steven Allan Spielberg was born in Cincinnati, Ohio, to Leah Frances (Posner), a concert pianist and restaurateur, and Arnold Spielberg, an electrical engineer who worked in computer development. His parents were both born to Russian Jewish immigrant families.

Name: Ivan Reitman
Bio: Ivan Reitman was born in Kom√°rno, Czechoslovakia.  He is a producer and director, has created many of American cinema's most successful and best loved feature film comedies and has worked with Hollywood's acting elite.

Name: Michael Lehmann
Bio: Michael Lehmann was born in San Francisco, California, USA as Michael Stephen Lehmann. He is a director and producer. He is married to Holland Sutton.

Name: Tim Burton
Bio: Timothy Walter Burton was born in Burbank, California, to Jean Rae (Erickson), who owned a cat-themed gift shop, and William Reed Burton, who worked for the Burbank Park and Recreation Department. He spent most of his childhood as a recluse, drawing cartoons, and watching old movies.

Name: Jim Sheridan
Bio: Jim Sheridan was born in Dublin, Ireland.  He is a master story-teller, and an acclaimed film director.  He is a father of 4 daughters, father of Clodagh Cherie Sheridan , Sheridan moved to America in 1982, meeting a man who invited him to run the Irish Arts Center.

Name: Ron Shelton
Bio: Ron Shelton was born in Whittier, California, USA as Ronald Wayne Shelton. He is a writer and director. He has been married to Lolita Davidovich since 1997. They have one child.

Name: Barbet Schroeder
Bio: Barbet Schroeder was born in Tehran, Iran. He is a director and producer. He has been married to Bulle Ogier since April 1991.

Name: Chris Columbus
Bio: Chris Columbus was born in Pennsylvania and raised in Ohio.  He was first inspired to make movies after seeing "The Godfather" at age 15. After enrolling at NYU film school, he sold his first screenplay (never produced) while a sophomore there.

Name: Charles Crichton
Bio: Charles Crichton was born in Wallasey, Cheshire, England.  His film career began as an editor in 1935 with Alexander Korda's London Films

Name: Brian De Palma
Bio: Brian De Palma is crom Newark, New Jersey.  He is the son of a surgeon. He studied physics but at the same time felt his dedication for the movies and made some short films.

Name: Oliver Stone
Bio: William Oliver Stone was born in New York City, to Jacqueline (Goddet) and Louis Stone, a stockbroker. His American father was from a Jewish family (from Germany and Eastern Europe), and his mother, a war bride, was French (and Catholic). After dropping out of Yale University, he became a soldier in the Vietnam War. Serving in two different regiments (including 1rst Cavalry), he was introduced to The Doors, drugs, Jefferson Airplane, and other things that defined the sixties. For his actions in the war, he was awarded a Bronze Star for Gallantry and a Purple Heart.

Name: Mike Figgis
Bio: Mike Figgis wasd born in Carlisle, Cumbria, England.  When he was young he lived with his four brothers and sisters in a council house in Newcastle Upon Tyne then when 14 the family moved to Thornyburn near Bellingham where he made his first film, 'Redheugh'. He qualified in Newcastle as a music teacher and played in a band, 'The Gasboard' with Brian Ferry before going to London to study music and worked with Performance Art Group and switched to acting

Name: Gore Verbinski
Bio: Born Gregor Verbinski in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, to Laurette Ann (McGovern) and Victor Vincent Verbinski, a nuclear physicist who worked at the Oak Ridge Lab. His paternal grandparents were Polish. In 1967, the family moved to California, and young Gregor grew up near San Diego. His biggest influences as a kid were Franz Kafka's Metamorphosis and Black Sabbath's Master of Reality.

Name: Christopher Guest
Bio: Christopher Haden-Guest was born in New York City.  He is a director, writer, musician, and composer best known for his mockumentaries, poking fun at heavy metal music, small town theatre, dog shows, folk music and film-making itsel.  His mother, Jean Pauline (Hindes), was a vice president of casting at CBS. His father, Peter Haden-Guest, was a UN diplomat who was a member of the British House of Lords, and was the fourth Baron of Saling in the County of Essex.

Name: Rob Reiner
Bio: Robert Reiner was born in New York City, to Estelle Reiner (n√©e Lebost) and Emmy-winning actor, comedian, writer, and producer Carl Reiner. As a child, he often looked up to his father as his inspiration and role-model. Carl Reiner was on The Dick Van Dyke Show, which he created and also starred in. Estelle was the inspiration for Rob Reiner to become a director. Her history as a singer helped him understand how music was used in a scene. Rob often felt pressured about measuring up to his father's twelve Emmys, and prestigious awards and successful streak.

Name: Robert Zemeckis
Bio: Robert Lee Zemeckis is from Chicago, Illinois.  A whiz-kid with special effects, Robert is from the Spielberg camp of film-making (Steven Spielberg produced many of his films). Usually working with writing partner Bob Gale, Robert's earlier films show he has a talent for zany comedy and special effect vehicles. His later films have become more serious.

Name: Paul Brickman
Bio: Paul Brickman was born on April 23, 1949 in Chicago, Illinois, USA. He is a writer and director.

Name: Dennis Dugan
Bio: Dennis Dugan was born in Wheaton, Illinois, USA as Dennis Barton Dugan. He is an actor and director. He is married to Sharon Dugan. He was previously married to Joyce Van Patten.

Name: Carl Reiner
Bio: Reiner was born in The Bronx, to Bessie (Mathias) and Irving Reiner, a watchmaker. His father was an Austrian Jewish immigrant and his mother was a Romanian Jewish immigrant. At the age of sixteen, while working as a sewing machine repairman, he attended a dramatic workshop sponsored by the Works Progress Administration.

Name: Frank Oz
Bio: Frank Richard Oznowicz was born in Hereford, England to puppeteers Frances and Isidore Oznowicz. His family moved to Montana in 1951, eventually settling in Oakland, California. As a teenager, he worked as an apprentice puppeteer at Children's Fairyland amusement park. He is one of the primary puppeteers responsible for the development of Jim Henson's Sesame Street (1969) and The Muppet Show (1976) as well as over 75 other Muppet productions.

Name: Tamra Davis
Bio: Tamra Davis was born in California.  She began her career directing music videos for acts like Tone Loc, Depeche Mode, NWA and Sonic Youth and made her first feature in 92 with Guncrazy starring Drew Barrymore. She then went on to direct feature films starring Chris Rock, Adam Sandler, Dave Chappelle and Britney Spears. After having 2 kids with her husband Mike D of the Beastie Boys she started a career in Network Television and has a popular online web show.

Name: John Landis
Bio: John Landis was born in Chicago, IL.  He began his career in the mail room of 20th Century-Fox. A high-school dropout, 18-year-old Landis made his way to Yugoslavia to work as a production assistant on Kelly's Heroes (1970). Remaining in Europe, Landis found work as an actor, extra and stuntman in many of the Spanish/Italian "spaghetti" westerns.

Name: Danny Boyle
Bio: Danny Boyle was born in Radcliffe, Greater Manchester, England as Daniel Francis Boyle. He is a director and producer.

Name: Jorma Taccone
Bio: Jorma Taccone was born in Berkeley, California.  His theatrical debut took place at Saint Mary's College-High School in Berkeley, California in 1993. He played one of the townspeople in The Visit by Friedrich Durrenmatt. His father, Berkeley Repertory Theatre Artistic Director Tony Taccone, attended his son's performance in spite of a recent surgery that had left him partially immobile with his leg in a cast.

Name: Ethan Coen
Bio: Ethan Coen was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA as Ethan Jesse Coen. He is a producer and writer.  He has been married to Tricia Cooke since October 2, 1990. They have two children.

Name: Joel Coen
Bio: Joel Coen was born on November 29, 1954 in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA as Joel Daniel Coen. He is a producer and writer. He has been married to Frances McDormand since April 1, 1984. They have one child.

Name: Paul Verhoeven
Bio: Paul Verhoeven was born in Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Netherlands.  He graduated from the University of Leiden, with a degree in math and physics. He entered the Royal Netherlands Navy, where he began his film career by making documentaries for the Navy and later for TV.

Name: Abel Ferrara
Bio: Born in the Bronx, Ferrara started making amateur films on Super 8 in his teens before making his debut with violent exploitation films.

Name: Michael Cimino
Bio: Michael Cimino was born in the New York City, New York, USA.  He studied architecture and dramatic arts; later he filmed advertisements and documentaries.  He died in Los Angeles, California
